title: Oshio-man
author: Oshio-man
content: Greetings my beloved Bitcointalk users, Merry Christmas to you all, I know many people have been busy enjoying themselves in this festive season celebration and holiday, I brought this topic to know what people have experienced from this bull season that reign in this month of November and December to hit $100k, I was not able to hold bitcoin this year because I was still learning on how to acquire the knowledge of bitcoin and how to hold bitcoins for long term before I can start investing in bitcoin, which I just achieved the knowledge few weeks ago waiting for funds to enter my hand before I can buy bitcoins. I notice that some people sold their bitcoins when the price was $70k, some sold when the price was $80k, some people sold when the price was $90k while some people sold when the price was $100k and above, and those that couldn't endure till $100k and above where not happy when they saw the price increased above $100k, despite they made income from the rate they use to sell their bitcoins, with what I have experienced from bitcoins bull season, i will never be in a hurry to sell my bitcoins, and I will be patient with my holding in the bull season, those are the major lesson I learned from this $100k that happened.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Oshio-man on December 25, 2024, 01:21:09 PM i will never be in a hurry to sell my bitcoins, and I will be patient with my holding in the bull season, those are the major lesson I learned from this $100k that happened.You are lucky that you started to study Bitcoin carefully, studying all its pros and cons, and saw the price movement, and the growth of Bitcoin, which many have been waiting for for several years. Now, having gone through many stages of training, you probably have set for yourself the time and the cost of Bitcoin, after which you will cash out your investments. I was not so persistent and spent some as needed, but I respect people who, albeit slowly, but persistently go to their goal. Saying the word "never" is too self-confident, but this Christmas, I sincerely wish you the fulfillment of your dream of having strong hands and good patience on your investment path.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: I learned that Bitcoin fees is no longer expensive even Bitcoin has achieving new ATH, so we don't have to complain about scalability issue since it's still fine. I thought the fees would reach 50 sat/vbyte at the lowest when Bitcoin price hit $100K, but now the fees is only 3 sat/vbyte, completely low than what I expect.Although it's due to off chain transactions, but I think majority of people are happy to see that instead of seeing Bitcoin fees rose really high.

As for selling of bitcoin there is nothing actually bad about that because every one has their take profit price target or time frame. People you see selling at $80k and $90k would even be in much higher profits than some selling at $100k or above. Everyone has its own target to take profit and to me sticking to it is the best way to go. We all can’t have one target so we definitely need some to sell so that we can even buy. My advice to you is when investing set a profit target too so you don’t just sell any price Quote from: Plaguedeath on December 25, 2024, 03:05:08 PMI learned that Bitcoin fees is no longer expensive even Bitcoin has achieving new ATH, so we don't have to complain about scalability issue since it's still fine. I thought the fees would reach 50 sat/vbyte at the lowest when Bitcoin price hit $100K, but now the fees is only 3 sat/vbyte, completely low than what I expect.Although it's due to off chain transactions, but I think majority of people are happy to see that instead of seeing Bitcoin fees rose really high.The scalability issue of Bitcoin network this days is mostly not a problem caused by bitcoin it self technically but by the other projects on bitcoin network like inscriptions and Runes which are used to span the network most of the time causing the congestion but since their hype die down there wasn’t a thing of such again. This means even without them the bitcoin network can manage large adoption rate. More so this period has shown that the fees doesn’t go up with the price

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: It's nice to see another person adopting Bitcoin but you need to be very careful as a newbie. And if I should advise you, buying the coin at the peak is not advisable, you may learn from those who bought it for around $60,000 in 2021, they were so bittered for over 2 years before Bitcoin went up again. This is not to scare you but to let you make an informed investment about whether you can HODL longer or not. If you can't, then buying the peak is not smart. Again, I love people divesting around the peak and buying Bitcoin when it's cheap at another bullish cycle's beginning.

comments.author: Jegileman
comments.body: Those that sold below $100K still baffles me because the bull run was not even at its peak yet and many thought of the US Presidential elections to be the cause of it. Those that sold at $100K is still fair to me because it was a milestone that have been talked about for long and everyone has been anticipating for the market to reach their one of this days. Overall, you don’t need to blame most of them for selling at a very lower price, some already set target and due to their discipline, they exit the market when it gets to that price. Some do not have a very strong psychology to be able to hold on for the market, so when they see little profits from their investments, they’re been bothered to take profit and exit the investment.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: In my case it's been pretty much the same boring thing. I've been holding for close to 10 years and I expected a post halving bull run. I did what I keep on doing every time - spending a very small % of my coins to celebrate a new ATH, get some gifts for myself and my family, have some fun, set aside a bit of fiat money. It's usually 1-2% that I spend during bull runs, but if we go above 110k, I might use another 1% to buy stuff that I don't necessarily need, but might set aside to have fun with next year, if the bear market hits.In other words, I have all that I need and I have the money to buy what I need, but there are things that I could have. For instance, I have a good photo printer, but I could have a better one if I had excess money. I have a decent car, but I could switch it to a similar model with 4x4. That's not a must, but there's always room for improvement

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: The most important lesson from this 100k run is that if you believe in something, stand behind it. There are so many people who sold their coins beforehand, even though they knew Bitcoin was going to get to this point. I've realized this much better. Never sell your Bitcoin if you don't urgently need cash money. Bitcoin is one of the best ways to protect your wealth against high inflation and economic crises.
